conclusion: Understanding the geometry and setup of the semicircular glass brick and light rays.
The tangent ray divides the semicircular surface into two regions affecting light exit.
The tangent ray refracts at the curved surface and exits through the base at point E.
The refracted ray at point E is perpendicular to the base.
Light passing through the base is confined to the region between points M and E.
Coordinate geometry of the semicircular brick with center at O and radius R.
The horizontal coordinate of point E is calculated using trigonometry: x_E = R cos γ.
The horizontal coordinate of point M is: x_M = -R.
The width ME is calculated as: ME = R (1 + cos γ).
The final answer for the width of the portion of the base through which light passes is ME = R (1 + cos γ).
